articles.headline: Trump’s Threats Over the Dollar Could Accelerate Push for Alternatives
articles.snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump threatened to impose tariffs on countries that seek to replace the dollar in trade or undermine its global reserve currency status.
articles.abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump threatened to impose tariffs on countries that seek to replace the dollar in trade or undermine its global reserve currency status.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Republicans nominated Donald J. Trump to be their presidential candidate over the summer, the party’s platform included a pledge to maintain the role of the United States dollar as the world’s reserve currency.

articles.headline: How Notre-Dame Was Reborn
articles.snippet: It took about 250 companies, 2,000 workers, about $900 million, a tight deadline and a lot of national pride.
articles.abstract: It took about 250 companies, 2,000 workers, about $900 million, a tight deadline and a lot of national pride.
articles.lead_paragraph: The embers of Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris were still hot when President Emmanuel Macron vowed that France would rebuild it to be “more beautiful than ever.”
articles.byline: By Aurelien Breeden and Jonathan Blezard

articles.headline: Everybody Loves FRED: How America Fell for a Data Tool
articles.snippet: From Facebook political debates to college classrooms, the St. Louis Fed’s data tool has gained a major following.
articles.abstract: From Facebook political debates to college classrooms, the St. Louis Fed’s data tool has gained a major following.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fans post about him on social media. Swag bearing his name sells out on the regular. College professors dedicate class sessions and textbook sections to him. Foreign government officials have been known to express jealousy over his skills, and one prominent economist refers to him as a “national treasure.”

articles.headline: Job Growth Rebounds With a Gain of 227,000 in November
articles.snippet: Hiring bounced back after disruptions from storms and a major strike.
articles.abstract: Hiring bounced back after disruptions from storms and a major strike.
articles.lead_paragraph: Job creation bounced back in November after disruptions from storms and a major strike, reinforcing a picture of modest employment expansion over the past several months.

articles.headline: The ‘Chilling’ Fatal Shooting of a C.E.O. Has Business Leaders on Edge
articles.snippet: After Brian Thompson of UnitedHealthcare was killed in Manhattan, the phones at corporate security firms were “ringing off the hook.”
articles.abstract: After Brian Thompson of UnitedHealthcare was killed in Manhattan, the phones at corporate security firms were “ringing off the hook.”
articles.lead_paragraph: A Fortune 500 pharmaceutical company raised its drug prices, and then board members and executives received phone calls threatening violence. A health care company’s board meeting was disrupted after board members were targeted in “swatting” attacks that wrongly sent law enforcement officers to their homes.

articles.headline: He Promised Huge Tax Refunds. Now Trump Wants Him to Lead the I.R.S.
articles.snippet: Since leaving Congress in 2023, Billy Long has peddled a pandemic-era tax credit that the I.R.S. has warned is a magnet for fraud.
articles.abstract: Since leaving Congress in 2023, Billy Long has peddled a pandemic-era tax credit that the I.R.S. has warned is a magnet for fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest news on Trump’s transition and staff picks.

articles.headline: TikTok Faces U.S. Ban After Losing Bid to Overturn New Law
articles.snippet: The law will ban the video app in the United States by Jan. 19 if its owner, ByteDance, does not sell it to a non-Chinese company.
articles.abstract: The law will ban the video app in the United States by Jan. 19 if its owner, ByteDance, does not sell it to a non-Chinese company.
articles.lead_paragraph: TikTok is one step closer to disappearing in the United States after a panel of federal judges on Friday unanimously upheld a new law that could lead to the banning of the popular Chinese-owned video app by mid-January.
